snippet: For young people exposed to traumatic violence like the Newtown school shooting, recovery can be torturous, marked by anxiety, nightmares or substance abuse. But the good news is that most children do heal.
abstract: Young people who are exposed to traumatic violence, like the Newtown, Conn, school shooting, often undergo difficult recovery marked by anxiety, nightmares or substance abuse; most children will heal, but the factors that determine how well a child may recover run a gamut from personal to environmental.
lead_paragraph: For young people exposed to traumatic violence like the Newtown school shooting, recovery can be torturous, marked by anxiety, nightmares or substance abuse. But the good news is that most children do heal.

headline.seo: For Young Survivors, Odds of Emotional Recovery Are High
headline.main: Children Can Usually Recover From Emotional Trauma
